channel.title: How to setup/ host hamachi for (noobs)
channel.description:
[Please don't delete or lock this topic it is very helpful for those setting up a server with hamachi]
Description: Getting hamachi to host correctly .
Difficulty: 1-2
Assumed Knowledge: Reading, looking at pictures
Well I'm making this tutorial because it seems a lot of kids don't know how to correctly host from hamachi.
-THIS IS A VERY DETAILED TUT & HOPE IT HELPS YOU
NOTE: you can only allow 12-16 players to play on your server with hamachi unless you pay for the product.
Step One:Downloading Hamachi
The very first thing we need to do is download hamachi before you download scan it for virus [url=https://secure.logmein.com/products/hamachi/register.aspx]https://secure.logmein.com/products/hamachi/register.aspx[/url] after downloading, install it you should get something like this: [img]http://img249.imageshack.us/img249/4148/194067297445600066.jpg[/img]
___________________________________________________________________________________ After it installed you should see this: [img]http://img189.imageshack.us/img189/8840/194067297931350349.jpg[/img] if you don't see this check your toolbar on your computer to see if there is a hamachi icon and click on it. Then click the power button to activate it
____________________________________________________________________________________ Now you need to create a network by the following:
To create a network,go to "Network" and click on "Create a new network." Then the program will ask you to create network id and pass this can be anything just remember it, also your name might be already taken. Then once you have came up with a username or pass click on create it.
_________________________________________________________________________________________
ALMOST DONE now if you want others to join you have to give them your network id (username) and password. They have to click on join an existing network so they can connect to your hamachi. If you see the ip it gives you on your hamachi lets say for example its 0.0.0.0 you and them need to use that ip when you login to your server. _________________________________________________________________________________________
DONE!
If you need any help or assistance leave a comment below or private message me

item.title: How to setup/ host hamachi for (noobs)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“GodexCAB, post:26, topic:417429”]Sorry for bringing back an old post, but I really need help. There is no way I can port forward with my current internet provider, so I need to use Hamachi. I have made my network, and I have 2 people who have tried logging into my server while my server was online. When they try connecting it says “Error connecting to server” can someone please help me?
Thank you.[/quote]
They need to be using Hamachi as well.

Read full topic

item.title: How to setup/ host hamachi for (noobs)
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

nickog15:

Hamachi is used for people that cant portforword. You most likely wont get ATONE of ppl on your server but friends and such you can get online. If you want to run a server off of hamachi, i will tell you now that you will NEVER get that server above 10 ppl. Good luck and nice guide.

not entirely true, I had a hamachi server a couple/ a year ago and i was able to get about 20 people with no lagg. but that was awhile ago, times have changed, people only play on servers that are vps hosted and crap.

Read full topic
